dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

levelledPara.title: Flow Monitoring

note.notePara: The actual measured delta pressure varies slightly with temperature and will vary considerably with product gas production rate.

levelledPara.para: A venturi (VN-636G) and two differential pressure transducers (DPT-1617-1G, DPT-1617-2G) provide flow monitoring for the process loop. (Refer to paragraph 3.9.2 for detailed description of the differential pressure transducers.) The venturi produces a differential pressure proportional to the water flow in the process loop. The differential pressure transducers monitor the differential pressure between the venturi inlet and throat. The measurement signals are then transmitted to the process controller. These signals are conditioned and used by the process controller to verify adequate flow through the electrolysis cell stack, and initiate a shutdown if the flow is too low. Normal flow in the recirculation loop is about 10 to 12 gpm.

The process controller initiates four messages (refer to Appendix B, table B-1), FS082 when the differential pressure is less than three psid (low flow) with the pump running, FW030 when the differential pressure is greater than 0.75 psig (high flow) with the pump OFF and FS098 and FS099 or faulty sensors. The process loop flow rate also provides indication if the filter (FLT-637G) is becoming clogged and is in need of cleaning. As more product gas is produced, it increases the pressure drop through the electrolysis cell stack and therefore results in lower flow rate (lower delta pressure).
